The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 29 March is 41,371 (4,788.4 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 24 March, there were 231 new confirmed cases (26.7 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 17 March, there were 315 new cases, and so the new cases have decreased by 27% (84 fewer cases).
